events.message: The policyholder reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at an intersection. Initial details were provided for claim initiation.
Based on the information submitted, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident as it involves a car collision on public roads.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and contact the claimant for further information.
The claimant received official acknowledgment of their auto accident claim and was informed about next steps and documentation requirements.
Requested submission of driver's license, vehicle registration, police report, and photos of the collision damage from the claimant.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including police report and vehicle damage photos required for further processing.
An investigation was initiated to verify details of the auto accident including liability assessment and damage evaluation.
The investigation concluded confirming fault assessment and extent of damages to the insured vehicle after the collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant reflecting the repair costs and coverage limits as agreed by the insurer.
The claimant provided positive feedback on the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the prompt processing.
Following the claimant’s acceptance, the auto accident claim was formally approved by the insurance company.
The payment corresponding to the approved settlement amount for vehicle repairs was issued to the claimant promptly.
The claim file was closed following successful payment and confirmation that the claimant’s needs have been met.
The complete documentation and records of the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and audit purposes.
